greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest odd prime base q such that p^13 divides q^(p-1) - 1, where p = Prime[n].
mathematica: Do[ k = 1; While[ !PowerMod[ Prime[ k ], Prime[ n ] - 1, Prime[ n ]^13 ] == 1, k++ ]; Print[ { n, Prime[ k ] } ], {n, 1, 100} ]
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Sep 26 2007
